title: Do you think Michael Jackson could have been a good rapper? - Quora

response.answer_text: As others have mentioned I think Michael could have been a good rapper had he tried, though I think it wouldn't have quite matched his style. He mostly lets others rappers rap in his songs like “Black Or White” and “Unbreakable”. However the way he sings on “They Don’t Care About Us” , and the last verses of “Can’t Let Her Get away” can be counted as rapping. He totally does it in “Money” and the best example Michael rapping is heard in the technically unreleased track “Shout”. This one is a pure rap song going into the hard aggressive style Michael pursued in HIStory. The bad news is that the track is badly mastered.

Yes I actually think he would have. I don’t know about from a lyrical perspective, but from a voice perspective, I think it would’ve been interesting. There are many crucial parts of rap performance that many people ignore in favor of lyricism, and I think he would have been excellent at all of these. Tone of voice, flow, modulation. To me, rap is as much of a vocal art as singing, but more subtle. Many of his songs incorporated instrumental elements extremely similar to many in modern rap. He had an ability to fit his voice to the song that has not been reached since. Michael’s unmatched ability to invoke emotion even with his speaking voice, the wide variety of voices and registers he used, and his incredible sense of rhythm, and separately his ability to use his voice as a rhythm instrument in itself his would have made him quite a good rapper. In many songs he basically did rap, such as “Smooth Criminal” and “They don’t care about us.” Plus, his hees hees and grunts and whatnot would’ve made for some interesting ad libs. For examples of songs that I think show the aforementioned abilities to use his voice as a dynamic instrument and his sense of rhythm see “Dirty Diana” “Human Nature” “Scream” and “PYT” (By the way thank you, I just got back into Michael by way of this question!)

He would’ve been a good (not great) rapper for his time, but nowhere near 2000s era rap. His raps may have also utilized his vocal range and his raspy tone. The downside would probably be that he’d actually hit the right notes against the beat that he might end up singing really fast instead. In terms of content, he’d probably be out of place from the rest of rap music, considering his lyrics are either humanity stuff or love stuff. I doubt he’d actually talk about his personal problems, like, I don’t think Billie Jean could’ve been a rap song even if it is actually one of those rap music material topics.

Very interesting question but yes I think he would have been a great rapper for the following reasons…..he was very energetic, entertaining, could carry an excellent rhythm with his verses, and also had an incredible voice just in general. I'd bet he would have been like Drake is now, just a musician who is capable of doing just about anything in any genre while still remaining unique and one of a kind, RIP the KING OF POP.

Of course he could have been, as can anyone with some practice. He had natural charisma and in many songs showed he had the ability to flow or taking his singing into these moments where it even sounded like spoken word. He always had great cadence in his songs. He also could beatbox, which makes me believe he could rap if he wanted.

I don't think Michael Jackson thought of himself as a rapper and he had collaborated a lot with many different “rappers” that he admired. He worked with Heavy D on Jam and The Notorious B. I. G. on Unbreakable. He even used one of his music producers, Bill Botrell, to do the rap on the iconic Black or white. I have watched an interview with Michael from 1987 in Japan where he started his Bad tour. The interviewer said that he considered Michael Jackson to be the person to bring rap type dancing “out of the ghettos and into mainstream culture”. But I have never heard Michael give himself credit for that. Geraldo Rivera asked him a similar question to the one your asking around the time Invincible was released and he intimated that it wasn't something he thought he was the best at. So, in conclusion, even though Michael probably had talent in every kind of music-he let the “rap experts” do all the heavy lifting.
I think he’d be a great rapper. He has the charisma and control over his voice down pat. He’d just need to be able to write the lyrics.
